data.title: So fun!
data.text: Me and my friend went and had a lot of fun! We don't know much about beer so the server was helpful on what kinds she thought we would like and let us sample a few. Try the key lime pie! Good burgers too!!

data.title: New to me
data.text:
What I liked about my visit was the food was great and the waitress was very helpful with any questions we had.
I will definitely head back.

data.title: Expensive beer and limited menu
data.text: Very limited menu selection. Only burgers, no other sandwiches  or salads. They had a large selection of tap beers but they were  overpriced.

data.title: good food
data.text:
good food, interesting place.  Friendly waiter no complaints.  only problem is parking.
good place for locals

data.title: Great beer selections
data.text: We didn't eat here so I cannot comment on the food (I think they only serve burgers and fries) but there is a great rotating selection of craft beers on tap. Patrick, our bartender, was very knowledgeable and friendly. I would absolutely recommend stopping in for a beer (or three).

data.title: First time dining
data.text: It was our first trip to a JL Beers. Going to the St Cloud store. Service was excellent and the burgers were really good.  Tried the Buffalo bleu cheese fries. Will have them every time I visit. Great beer selection.  We will be back. Highly recommend!

data.title: Delicious veggie burgers, good service
data.text:
We stopped in on a Sunday afternoon and the place was surprisingly busy. Our waiter Andrew was super profession and informed. He kept a good eye on us and let us a try a few of the beers on tap before we made a selection. He also recommended the twisty potatoes which was a win with both of us. 

The only thing on the menu here are burgers and fries. That is it. Don't go expecting to get anything else! But, they do have a good, interesting selection of burgers. Both of us don't eat beef/pork, but they advised that they had a veggie (black bean/wild rice) burger that could be subbed for any regular burger patty. We were both happy about that. I chose a mushroom, swiss, teriyaki burger. My spouse chose a burger with a fried egg and cheese on it. They also have fresh cut potato fries in 2 forms: regular cut and spiral cut. My spouse got the regular and I got the curls. Hands down the curls are the winner in both taste and texture. We were both happy with our burgers. The veggies patties do have a little bit of a kick to them, but I am a spice baby. So, a regular-level spice tolerant person may not even notice. They had good flavor. 

The menu is pretty cheap, but they charge the fries and burgers separately, so it looks slightly cheaper than it is. Still, you get a good burger and delicious fresh cut fries for under $10.

data.title: Great food good beer choices
data.text: The place is a typical tap bar with burgers.  The burgers was really good.  I had a St Germaine Street which was basically a bacon cheese burger with bbq sauce.  It was really good.  Coupled with fries and a Deschutes Black Butte Porter it was a good lunch.  Service was really good considering it was really busy.  They had a special of $1 burgers, that is a deal that can not be beat.

data.title: Great Atmosphere  & Food
data.text: Fantastic burgers and we never had to wait for refills on our berr. Our server was knowledgeable  and very polite. We will be back!

data.title: Great burgers!
data.text: We went out for burgers and beers to celebrate some birthdays. JL Beers has delicious burgers for a great price! They also have a large selection of beer on tap. We will definitely go there again.

data.title: Great burgers
data.text: Stopped on a Saturday afternoon.  Not very busy, but not many people downtown on a week-end.  Had the gyro burger.  It was so good.  And also had a burger with blue cheese and that was also very good. Didn't try the beer, but a very large selection--next time.  No salads or wine, but I guess you don't go to a burger place for those.  Will definitely go back.  Very nice atmosphere.  Totally redone.

data.title: Great beer selection
data.text: JL Beers is fairly new to town, but they are doing a great job.  The tap selection changes all the time, and the service has been pretty good.  I have heard great things about their food, but have yet to try it.  I do think they are a liittle high on their prices.

data.title: Stopped in for a beer...
data.text:
They have a friendly staff and a good selection of beer.  The place has been completely gutted and remodeled and doesn't resemble it's former self -Which is good.
Good Job!

data.title: Best burger in town!
data.text:
Tons of beers! Not just IPAs either! Cool and unique beers. But, I have to say, the best surprise for me... The GYRO BURGER! I've never tasted a burger quite like it. Greant new flavors for me. This burger was a special; I don't think it was a menu mainstay. 

And the Mt. Mushmore! I was nervous about the teriyaki sauce, but is not slathered! Just a wonderful burst of flavorful goodness!

data.title: Great burgers!
data.text: We went here for lunch with a few people. Great burgers and beer selection. Service was good too. No kids allowed, you can decide if that is a pro or con. I will be back and will recommend!

data.title: Nice Beer Selection, Great Mobile App
data.text: Nice beer selection of 40 taps. I love their mobile app, which updates as the tap lines change. The music was almost too loud for conversation. Younger crowd, mostly college. I was there on a Friday afternoon. Small space, but cozy. Nice remodel of an older building. Friendly staff of 6 for 20 customers...a business model unlikely to succeed in the long run. The food menu is burgers, fries, and chips. I prefer 7 West Taphouse, which is a couple blocks away, because it has a better beer selection, more menu choices, and is less expensive. St. Cloud is fortunate to have 2 beer tap houses downtown.
